info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 6:29PM EDT until May 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, beach erosion and beach flooding around the times of high tide. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected.
* WHERE...Southeast Suffolk County.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT Friday through Friday evening.
* SHORELINE IMPACTS...Along the north shore of the south fork, breaking waves of 1 to 3 feet may cause dune erosion and localized washovers, as well as enhance splashover and flooding onto shoreline roads and properties. Along the oceanfront, breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet on an east to west sweep will result in beach erosion and beach flooding during the times of high tide. Localized dune erosion is possible.
* RIP CURRENT IMPACTS...Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING
